alert.note: Alert for Briscoe; Floyd; Hale; Lubbock; Lynn; Swisher; Terry (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued March 29 at 2:48PM CDT until March 30 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE CENTRAL SOUTH PLAINS AND THE FAR SOUTH CENTRAL TEXAS PANHANDLE... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE CENTRAL SOUTH PLAINS AND THE FAR SOUTH CENTRAL TEXAS PANHANDLE... * Timing...Noon to 10 PM CDT for the Fire Weather Watch on Thursday. 9 AM to 10 PM CDT for the Fire Weather Watch on Friday. * Wind...Southwest at 25 to 30 mph with gusts up to 50 mph on Thursday. West at 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 55 mph on Friday. * Humidity...As low as 14 percent on Thursday. As low as 8 percent on Friday. * Fuels...Critically Dry. * Impacts...Any fires that develop can spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is discouraged.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.

area.areaDesc: Briscoe; Floyd; Hale; Lubbock; Lynn; Swisher; Terry
